oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A radical cyclization approach to the formal total syntheses of platencin
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PALANICHAMY, K
SUBRAHMANYAM, AV
KALIAPPAN, KP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ALPHA,BETA-UNSATURATED CARBONYL-COMPOUNDS
FATTY-ACID BIOSYNTHESIS
ACTIVATED DIMETHYL-SULFOXIDE
C-ARYL GLYCOSIDES
ANTIBACTERIAL PROPERTIES
HYDROXYL GROUP
STREPTOMYCES-PLATENSIS
ENANTIOSELECTIVE ROUTE
BIOLOGICAL EVALUATION
ANTIBIOTIC PROPERTIES
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two different strategies leading to formal total syntheses of platencin are described. The first strategy involving Claisen rearrangement and radical cyclization provides a rapid access to the core structure of platencin, and also use minimum protective-group operations. The second strategy, a protecting group-free route, utilizes a 6-exo-trig radical cyclization and aldol condensation as key steps leading to the formal synthesis of platencin.
